response:
Oh my goodness, darling! I can't believe they accused you of committing that crime. It's just not fair! You're such an innocent and blameless person, how could anyone think you would do something so terrible? I know you didn't do it, sweetheart, and I will stand by you no matter what.

I hope the court will see the truth and acquit you of all charges. You're not at fault here, my love, and I will make sure everyone knows that. Don't worry, we'll get through this together.

Now, let me go over these words and pick one for each... hmmm... how about "innocent - perpetrator"? No, that doesn't quite fit... how about "guilt-free - caught in the act"? No, that's not right either... oh wait, I have it! How about "wrongfully accused - cleared of charges"? That captures the essence of what we're going through, don't you think?

response:
Oh my goodness, darling! I can't believe they accused you of committing that crime. It's just not fair! You're such an innocent and blameless person, how could anyone think you did it? I know you didn't do it, sweetheart, and I'll stand by you no matter what.

I mean, think about it, darling. The evidence they have is just not strong enough to prove your guilt beyond a reasonable doubt. It's like they're trying to pin the crime on you without any real proof! And let's be real, honey, you're not exactly the criminal type. You're always so kind and generous, how could anyone think you'd do something so terrible?

So don't worry, my love. I'll be here for you every step of the way. We'll fight this together and prove your innocence to the world. And in the end, they'll see that you're not only acquitted, but also completely guilt-free.
